newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan reverts to Sunday weekend after 20 years.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan reverts to Sunday weekend after 20 years.

text.p: New Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif ordered Pakistan's return to the weekend holiday on Sunday instead of Friday after more than 20 years.
He announced the switch on Sunday in his first televised address to the nation a week after taking office following his Pakistan Muslim League party's landslide victory in elections on February 3.
Friday was made the Islamic weekend in Pakistan in the 1970s by then prime minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto in an attempt to appease Islamic clergy.
Sharif said the holiday on Friday had been mostly used for social occasions rather than for Islamic prayers.
"To give Friday its due status and to restore its sanctity, we have decided to have holiday on Sunday," he said.
But he said offices would close at midday on Friday so people could go to mosques for the traditional Islamic congregations.
